greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest semiprime q such that 2*prime(n) - q is semiprime, or a(n)=0 if there is no such q.
comment: Conjecture: every even semiprime more than 22 is a sum of two semiprimes.
All terms are either 4 or odd.
If a(n) = 4, then 2*prime(n)-4=2*(prime(n)-2) is a semiprime, thus prime(n)-2 is a prime, so prime(n) belongs to A006512 (greater of twin primes). - _Michel Marcus_, Mar 26 2015
link: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: NextSemiPrime[n_, k_: 1] := Block[{c = 0, sgn = Sign[k]}, sp = n + sgn; While[c < Abs[k], While[ PrimeOmega[sp] != 2, If[ sgn < 0, sp--, sp++]]; If[ sgn < 0, sp--, sp++]; c++]; sp + If[sgn < 0, 1, -1]]; f[n_] := Block[{p2 = 2 Prime[n], sp = 4}, While[ PrimeOmega[p2 - sp] != 2, sp = NextSemiPrime[sp]]; If[ sp != p2, sp, 0]]; Array[f, 75] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 25 2014 *)
results.author: _Vladimir Shevelev_, Apr 25 2014
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 25 2014
